author: Staff Reporter
text:
Forest department personnel at Gudalur have imposed a fine of Rs. 1 lakh on five persons for allegedly hunting Sambar Deer and selling its meat.

District Forest Officer (DFO) of Gudalur S.N. Thejasvi said that two days ago the department staff recovered carcass of a deer at Devan Tea Estate in Sri Madurai located on the Gudalur and Mudumalai border.

Post-mortem revealed that the animal was hunted for meat. During inquiry the personnel arrested five non-tribals living in The Nilgiris. “Inquiry revealed that they sold the meat to a few resorts at Masinagudi.

A fine of Rs. 20,000 was imposed on each of them. We suspected the role of a few more persons in the act and are taking efforts to arrest them,” the DFO said.
title: Poachers fined for hunting deer
